ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend it, but make sure they knew that it would entail a lot of hard work and dedication. It won't be easy, but if you try to get help and work with your fellow students it'll work out well.
I would recommend the mathematics 120 course for a student who either loves math or needs it for a distributional requirement. It may be me personally, but I don't really enjoy this type of class..

I heard a lot of bad things about intro math classes at Yale, and I found this one to be much more bearable than Iâd been led to believe. I took it after not having taken math for a while (Iâm a junior, and took BC calculus my senior year of high school). That definitely made it more difficult, but if youâre in the same boat as I was and donât want to re-take the concepts youâve already learned, Iâd say donât be scared to start in 120. You can always drop down if it doesnât work out. Lots of resources available for help â use them â and Slava was a good teacher, in the scheme of what I saw during shopping period. Bear in mind that, for this semester at least, he gave weekly quizzes on Friday which were very hard. He also tends to pull out some crazy-seeming concepts that other professors donât go over, but they often eventually proved useful.

Math 120 was a good course for those who like math for the sake of solving math problems/applying algorithms, but it was a bit lacking in visible practical application. I would recommend Math 120 for a student who lives and breathes mathematics, but I would hesitate to recommend it for a student who, like me, has simply liked math for all of his/her life and hoped to continue an interest in math. That being said, it could have just been my teacher in particular that somewhat negatively affected my experience.
I would definitely recommend this course to someone who is taking/going to take physics. It would be also more interesting for someone going to continue studying maths or sciences.
